trace.description: This topic will push all change events of your orders. Compared with v1, v2 adds an Order Status: "new", there is no difference in push speed
This topic will push all change events of your orders.
You will receive this message when an account balance changes. The message contains the details of the change.
This topic will push all change events of your stop orders.

clientOid.description: Client Order ID: The ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the user

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

x-api-enum.name: new
x-api-enum.description: the order enters the matching system

x-api-enum.name: open
x-api-enum.description: the order is in the order book (maker order)

x-api-enum.name: match
x-api-enum.description: when taker order executes with orders in the order book, the taker order status is “match”

x-api-enum.name: done
x-api-enum.description: the order is fully executed successfully

x-api-enum.name: open
x-api-enum.description: the order is in the order book (maker order)

x-api-enum.name: match
x-api-enum.description: The message sent when the order is match, 1. When the status is open and the type is match, it is a maker match.  2. When the status is match and the type is match, it is a taker match.

x-api-enum.name: update
x-api-enum.description: The message sent due to the order being modified: STP triggering, partial cancellation of the order. Includes these three scenarios:  1. When the status is open and the type is update: partial amounts of the order have been canceled, or STP triggers  2. When the status is match and the type is update: STP triggers  3. When the status is done and the type is update: partial amounts of the order have been filled and the unfilled part got canceled, or STP is triggered.

x-api-enum.name: filled
x-api-enum.description: The message sent when the status of the order changes to DONE after the transaction

x-api-enum.name: canceled
x-api-enum.description: The message sent when the status of the order changes to DONE due to being canceled

x-api-enum.name: received
x-api-enum.description: The message sent when the order enters the matching system. When the order has just entered the matching system and has not yet done matching logic with the counterparty, a private message with the message type "received" and the order status "new" will be pushed.

liquidity.description: Actual transaction order type, If the counterparty order is an [Hidden/Iceberg Order](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146), even if it is a maker order, this param will be displayed as taker. For actual trading fee, please refer to the **feeType**

tradeId.description: Trade ID: Generated by Matching engine.

clientOid.description: Client Order ID: The ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the user

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

tradeId.description: Trade ID: Generated by Matching engine.

available.description: Funds available to withdraw or trade

hold.description: Funds on hold (not available for use)

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

stop.description: Order type: loss: stop loss order, oco: oco order

tradeType.description: The type of trading: TRADE (Spot), MARGIN_TRADE (Cross Margin), MARGIN_ISOLATED_TRADE (Isolated Margin).

x-api-enum.name: open
x-api-enum.description: The order is in the order book (maker order)

x-api-enum.description: The message sent when the order is matched, 1. When the status is open and the type is match, it is a maker match.  2. When the status is match and the type is match, it is a taker match.
